Package world

Class BeeHive

Object
world.BeeHive
public class BeeHive
extends Object
The BeeHive is the center of the world for the bees. It is the place where the resources gathered by the workers (nectar and pollen) are stored. These resources will be used by the Queen bee who mates with her drones and uses the resources in order to support reproduction.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

  • Method Summary

    void addBee​(Bee bee)
    Whenever a bee is born after the simulation starts, they are added to the beehive and should immediately start doing their task.
    void beePerished​(Bee bee)
    When a bee perishes (a drone mates with the queen), the bee hive takes note of this unfortunate, but necessary event for the circle of life and adds them to the collection of perished bees.

  • Constructor Details

    • BeeHive

      public BeeHive​(int numDrones, int numNectarWorkers, int numPollenWorkers)
      Create the bee hive. You should create the flower field and the queen's chamber here. The bees should be created here with the suggested order of the queen first, the drone bees second, and the worker bees third (nectar and then pollen).
      Parameters:
      numDrones - number of starting drones
      numNectarWorkers - number of starting nectar workers
      numPollenWorkers - number of starting pollen workers

  • Method Details

    • getFlowerField

      public FlowerField getFlowerField()
      Get the flower field. Having this here reduces the amount of passing we have to do. The worker bees who need the field can get it from the bee hive.
      Returns:
      the field of flowers

    • getQueensChamber

      public QueensChamber getQueensChamber()
      Get the queen's chamber. The queen bee and the drones need to be aware of this.
      Returns:
      the queen's chamber

    • getNumBorn

      public int getNumBorn()
      How many total bees were born?
      Returns:
      total born

    • getPerishedBees

      public Collection<Bee> getPerishedBees()
      Get the collection of bees who perished.
      Returns:
      the perished bees

    • getRemainingNectar

      public int getRemainingNectar()
      How much nectar is left in the bee hive?
      Returns:
      nectar remaining

    • getRemainingPollen

      public int getRemainingPollen()
      How much pollen is left in the bee hive?
      Returns:
      pollen remaining

    • getNectarGathered

      public int getNectarGathered()
      How much total nectar was gathered?
      Returns:
      total nectar gathered

    • getPollenGathered

      public int getPollenGathered()
      How much total pollen was gathered?
      Returns:
      total pollen gathered

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Is the simulation still going?
      Returns:
      if the bee hive is active or not

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Start the simulation. When the simulation starts, you should first display the message

      *BH* Bee hive begins buzzing

      Then you should start all the bees (queen, workers and drones).
      Precondition
      The bees have not started running
      Postcondition
      All the bees have been signaled to begin running

    • end

      public void end()
      When the simulation ends the bee hive is no longer active. All the bees trigger of this to stop doing their normal job and shutdown. At the start print out the message and switch the active flag off:

      *BH* Bee hive is becoming inactive!
      At the end once all the bees have finished print out the message:

      *BH* Bee hive stops buzzing!

      Precondition
      The bees are either running or have completed their task, e.g. the drones that mated have perished.
      Postcondition
      All the bees have been finished running

    • beePerished

      public void beePerished​(Bee bee)
      When a bee perishes (a drone mates with the queen), the bee hive takes note of this unfortunate, but necessary event for the circle of life and adds them to the collection of perished bees.
      Parameters:
      bee - the bee that perished

    • addBee

      public void addBee​(Bee bee)
      Whenever a bee is born after the simulation starts, they are added to the beehive and should immediately start doing their task.
      Parameters:
      bee - the new bee

    • hasResources

      public boolean hasResources()
      If the bee hive has at least 1 unit of both nectar and pollen, it meets one of the conditions by the queen for mating with a drone.
      Returns:
      do we have enough resources?

    • claimResources

      public void claimResources()
      When the queen is ready to mate with a drone, they will claim 1 unit of each resource.
      Precondition
      hasResources() is true

    • deposit

      public void deposit​(Worker.Resource resource, Worker bee)
      Add a new resource to the bee hive. The worker bees when returning from the flower field will deposit their 1 unit of either nectar or pollen for storage. At the start display the message:

      *BH* {bee} deposits

      Parameters:
      resource - the resource
      bee - the worker bee who deposited the resource
      Precondition
      the bee hive is still active
